Sentencas: Solid-gas interactions at electrode surfaces determine the efficiency of solid-oxide fuel cells and electrolyzers.
Titulo: Correlating Surface Crystal Orientation and Gas Kinetics in Perovskite Oxide Electrodes

Sentencas: Here, the correlation between surface-gas kinetics and the crystal orientation of perovskite electrodes is studied in the model system La0.8Sr0.2Co0.2Fe0.8O3.
Titulo: Correlating Surface Crystal Orientation and Gas Kinetics in Perovskite Oxide Electrodes

Sentencas: The gas-exchange kinetics are characterized by synthesizing epitaxial half-cell geometries where three single-variant surfaces are produced [i.e., La0.8Sr0.2Co0.2Fe0.8O3/La0.9Sr0.1Ga0.95Mg0.05O3-delta/SrRuO3/SrTiO3 (001), (110), and (111)].
Titulo: Correlating Surface Crystal Orientation and Gas Kinetics in Perovskite Oxide Electrodes

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and electrical conductivity relaxation measurements reveal a strong surface-orientation dependency of the gas-exchange kinetics, wherein (111)-oriented surfaces exhibit an activity >3-times higher as compared to (001)-oriented surfaces.
Titulo: Correlating Surface Crystal Orientation and Gas Kinetics in Perovskite Oxide Electrodes

Sentencas: Oxygen partial pressure (pO2)-dependent electrochemical impedance spectroscopy studies reveal that while the three surfaces have different gas-exchange kinetics, the reaction mechanisms and rate-limiting steps are the same (i.e., charge-transfer to the diatomic oxygen species).
Titulo: Correlating Surface Crystal Orientation and Gas Kinetics in Perovskite Oxide Electrodes

Sentencas: First-principles calculations suggest that the formation energy of vacancies and adsorption at the various surfaces is different and influenced by the surface polarity.
Titulo: Correlating Surface Crystal Orientation and Gas Kinetics in Perovskite Oxide Electrodes

Sentencas: Finally, synchrotron-based, ambient-pressure X-ray spectroscopies reveal distinct electronic changes and surface chemistry among the different surface orientations.
Titulo: Correlating Surface Crystal Orientation and Gas Kinetics in Perovskite Oxide Electrodes

Sentencas: Taken together, thin-film epitaxy provides an efficient approach to control and understand the electrode reactivity ultimately demonstrating that the (111)-surface exhibits a high density of active surface sites which leads to higher activity.
Titulo: Correlating Surface Crystal Orientation and Gas Kinetics in Perovskite Oxide Electrodes
